unnormalised: Hey everyone, quick question! I’m a bit confused about all the different titles people use in the medical field. Like, what’s the difference between a Dr., a Prof., and all those other abbreviations? My cousin, Priya, just finished her MBBS and I’m trying to understand what her career path might look like. She is planning to do MD in internal medicine.
normalised: Hey everyone, quick question! I am a bit confused about all the different titles people use in the medical field. Like, what is the difference between a Doctor, a Professor, and all those other abbreviations? My cousin, Priya, just finished her M-B-B-S and I am trying to understand what her career path might look like. She is planning to do M-D in internal medicine.

unnormalised: Is a Dr. just anyone with an MBBS? And when does someone become a Prof.? Is that just for people who teach at medical colleges like AIIMS or CMC Vellore? Also, I saw a consultant at Apollo Hospital the other day and his nameplate said "Dr. R. Kumar, FRCS." What does FRCS even mean? So many abbreviations!
normalised: Is a Doctor just anyone with an M-B-B-S? And when does someone become a Professor? Is that just for people who teach at medical colleges like A-I-I-M-S or C-M-C Vellore? Also, I saw a consultant at Apollo Hospital the other day and his nameplate said "Doctor R. Kumar, F-R-C-S." What does F-R-C-S even mean? So many abbreviations!

unnormalised: Then there are titles like "Registrar" or "Resident". I saw "Dr. Sharma, Senior Resident" at the hospital in my hometown, Lucknow. Are those temporary positions for doctors who are still training? It’s all so confusing! I wish there was a simple guide or something. Even my parents, who have been going to doctors for years, couldn't explain it properly.
normalised: Then there are titles like "Registrar" or "Resident". I saw "Doctor Sharma, Senior Resident" at the hospital in my hometown, Lucknow. Are those temporary positions for doctors who are still training? It is all so confusing! I wish there was a simple guide or something. Even my parents, who have been going to doctors for years, couldn't explain it properly.

unnormalised: Maybe someone working in a hospital, like a nurse or even a "Dr." themselves, could break it down? I'd really appreciate a clear explanation. Even something as simple as "MBBS means this, MD means that" would be super helpful. And maybe a few examples with names would make it easier to remember.
normalised: Maybe someone working in a hospital, like a nurse or even a "Doctor" themselves, could break it down? I would really appreciate a clear explanation. Even something as simple as "M-B-B-S means this, M-D means that" would be super helpful. And maybe a few examples with names would make it easier to remember.

unnormalised: Thanks in advance for any help! Hoping someone can clear up this medical title mystery for me! I really wanna understand all of it before Priya starts her MD so I can cheer her on properly and not sound completely clueless!
normalised: Thanks in advance for any help! Hoping someone can clear up this medical title mystery for me! I really want to understand all of it before Priya starts her M-D so I can cheer her on properly and not sound completely clueless!
